items.title: Former U.Va. President Details Justice Department Pressure That Led to Ouster
items.summary: In an extraordinary 12-page letter, James E. Ryan described the pressure campaign leading to his resignation as akin to a “hostage situation.”

items.title: Trump Demands Inquiry Into Epstein’s Ties to Prominent Democrats
items.summary: The move appeared to be retaliation after Democrats released emails suggesting the president knew about Epstein’s sex-trafficking operation.

items.title: Georgia Prosecutor Steps In to Oversee Trump Election Case
items.summary: The official, Pete Skandalakis, had been tasked by law with finding a new prosecutor for the election interference case after Fani T. Willis was removed from it.

items.title: Trump Turns to Affordability Message Amid Economic Frustration
items.summary: The Trump administration is facing backlash from American consumers as higher costs from tariffs blunt wage gains.

items.title: In a Brutal Mississippi Jail, Inmates Say They Were Enlisted as Enforcers
items.summary: High-ranking inmates known as trusties were ordered to do guards’ bidding, former inmates and guards said, and the culture of violence in the jail went straight to the top.

items.title: America First? Some Trump Supporters Worry That’s No Longer the Case.
items.summary: President Trump has been dining with billionaires and has taken a keen interest in crises overseas, leading to fears that he is drifting away from his more populist stances.

items.title: Trump dismisses mounting questions over Epstein links, then threatens Democratic foes with justice department investigation – live
items.summary: <p>As he faces scrutiny amid latest Epstein email release, US president seeks to use Department of Justice to investigate opponents including Bill Clinton</p><p><br></p><p>The US trade representative, <strong>Jamieson Greer</strong>, said that the US has “essentially reached a deal with Switzerland”, after the country was hit with a 39% tariff on Swiss exports to the US.</p><p>“We’re really excited about that deal and what it means for American manufacturing,” Greer told CNBC today in an interview.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/nov/14/us-politics-latest-news-donald-trump-ice-bishops-jeffrey-epstein">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: US tariffs on Swiss goods cut to 15% in deal struck with Trump administration
items.summary: <p>In exchange, Swiss officials committed to series of quotas for imports from the US on a duty-free basis</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/nov/14/us-politics-latest-news-donald-trump-ice-bishops-jeffrey-epstein">US politics live – latest updates</a></p></li></ul><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/donaldtrump">Donald Trump</a> agreed to cut <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/trump-tariffs">US tariffs</a> on <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/switzerland">Switzerland</a> from 39% to 15% as part of a new trade pact, lowering duties that strained economic ties and hit Swiss exporters.</p><p>The two countries have signed a “non-binding memorandum of understanding”, the Swiss government announced, following bilateral talks in Washington and intense lobbying by Swiss firms.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/14/tariffs-swiss-goods-reduced">Continue reading...</a>
